item.title: 糟糕透顶饱受打击的小盘股迎来买入窗口
item.description: 规模最小的美股已进入一年中历史上最有利的时期，这让人们对这一陷入困境的群体在 2025 年惨淡开局后能够反弹抱有更大希望。【原文：The smallest US stocks have entered a historically favorable time of year, boosting hopes that the beleaguered group can rebound after a dismal start to 2025.】

item.title: 南非经常账户赤字略有收窄
item.description: 南非第一季度的经常账户赤字略有收窄，超出了人们对赤字扩大的预期。【原文：South Africa’s current-account deficit narrowed slightly in the first quarter, beating expectations for it to widen.】

item.title: 美国医保政策使交易 "异常艰难"，降临者说
item.description: 安宏资本管理合伙人约翰-马尔多纳多（John Maldonado）认为，美国的医疗保健政策对投资者构成了挑战，而欧洲的医疗保健行业则存在机遇。【原文：Health-care policy in the US poses a challenge for investors, whereas there are areas of opportunity in the sector in Europe, according to John Maldonado, managing partner at Advent.】

item.title: 交易员涌入小众期权市场押注原油供应过剩
item.description: 投资者在石油市场一个相对模糊的角落加大了赌注，认为欧佩克+增产将导致今年年底到 2026 年最终出现供应过剩。【原文：Investors have ramped up wagers in a relatively obscure corner of the oil market that OPEC+ output hikes will lead to an eventual glut toward the end of this year and into 2026.】

item.title: Zippo在法庭上的挫败增强了欧盟报复特朗普的权利
item.description: 欧盟对美国商品和服务征收报复性关税的权力获得了该集团最高法院顾问的法律支持，因为这个由 27 个成员国组成的司法管辖区继续与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普就贸易问题发生争执。【原文：The European Union’s power to impose retaliatory tariffs on US goods and services won a legal boost from an adviser to the bloc’s top court, as the 27-member jurisdiction continues to spar with President Donald Trump over trade.】

item.title: 铃木因报告称稀土限制影响汽车生产而下跌
item.description: 铃木汽车公司停止生产一款畅销车型，当地媒体报道称中国对稀土的出口限制是导致生产中断的幕后原因，铃木汽车公司股价延续跌势。【原文：Suzuki Motor Corp. shares extended a slump after the automaker halted production of a popular car model, with local media reporting China’s export restrictions on rare earths are behind the disruption.】

item.title: 英国建筑商以全球金融危机后的速度裁员
item.description: 一项调查显示，英国建筑业的薪资缩水速度上一次出现在 2010 年，当时还不包括大流行病，该调查使人们对工党政府的建筑业繁荣雄心产生了怀疑。【原文：Payrolls in the UK construction industry shrank at a pace last seen in 2010, when excluding the pandemic, according to a survey that casts doubt over the Labour government’s ambition for a building boom.】

item.title: 越南咖啡作物将因雨量充沛而增产
item.description: 由于降雨量大，供应前景看好，越南的咖啡作物有了一个强劲的开端，这可能会对接近七个月低点的全球价格造成进一步的压力。【原文：Vietnam’s coffee crop is off to a strong start as heavy rainfall bolstered the supply outlook, which could put further pressure on global prices that are near a seven-month low.】

item.title: 泽西市市长谈该市如何建造如此多的住房
item.description:
与民主党州长候选人史蒂文-富洛普的对话

【原文：

A conversation with Democratic gubernatorial candidate Steven Fulop

】

item.title: 特拉菲古拉公司警告说，由于派息超过利润，贸易将面临逆风
item.description: 大宗商品巨头特拉菲古拉集团（Trafigura Group）警告说，市场波动可能不会为其交易商带来机会，因为该集团上半年的财报显示，其股息支出超过了净利润。【原文：Trafigura Group warned that market volatility may not translate to opportunities for its traders, as the commodity giant reported first-half results that showed its dividend payments exceeded net profit.】

item.title: 泽西市市长谈该市如何建造如此多的住房
item.description: 泽西市市长谈该市如何建造如此多的住房【原文：Jersey City’s Mayor on How the City Built So Much Housing】

item.title: Ola Electric 创始人在股价下跌时充值抵押品
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Ola Electric Mobility Ltd.的创始人兼首席执行官巴维什-阿加瓦尔（Bhavish Aggarwal）支付了约2亿卢比（约合230万美元）现金，以充实股票借款的抵押品，因为该公司的股票因销售不佳而下滑。【原文：Bhavish Aggarwal, founder and chief executive officer of Ola Electric Mobility Ltd., paid about 200 million rupees ($2.3 million) in cash to top up collateral for borrowings against shares, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as the stock slid on poor sales.】

item.title: 欧洲天然气走高，挪威检修限制了天然气流量
item.description: 欧洲天然气价格上涨，原因是在新一轮计划检修中，来自最大供应国挪威的天然气流量急剧下降。【原文：European natural gas prices rose as flows from top supplier Norway plunged amid a fresh bout of planned maintenance.】

item.title: 统计局称数据错误推高了英国 4 月份的通货膨胀率
item.description: 英国统计局称，由于运输部提供的数据有误，4 月份的通货膨胀率比应公布的数字高出 0.1 个百分点。【原文：Britain’s statistics office has said April’s inflation number was 0.1 percentage point higher than it should have been due to an error in data provided by the Department for Transport.】

item.title: 可可价格高企，瑞士巧克力股走势分化
item.description: 今年，瑞士两家最大巧克力生产商的股价走势明显不同，因为可可价格飙升对其中一家巧克力生产商造成的障碍比对另一家更大。【原文：Shares in two of Switzerland’s biggest chocolatiers are on markedly different courses this year as soaring cocoa prices prove a tougher obstacle for one than they do for the other.】

item.title: Wizz 预测收入增长，停飞飞机数量减少
item.description: 威兹航空控股公司（Wizz Air Holdings Plc）预计，随着该航空公司从停飞飞机和阻碍增长的发动机问题中恢复过来，下一财年将创造更多收入。【原文：Wizz Air Holdings Plc expects to generate more revenue in its next fiscal year as the airline recovers from engine issues that have grounded aircraft and stunted growth.】

item.title: 瑞典核心通胀放缓支持 6 月降息
item.description: 瑞典的基本通胀率降至五个月来的最低点，基本符合预期，这也加强了瑞典央行本月晚些时候降息的理由。【原文：Sweden’s underlying inflation rate fell to a five-month low, broadly in line with expectations and strengthening the case for the Riksbank to reduce interest rates later this month.】

item.title: 美国宣布加征关税后，德国工厂订单仍有所增长
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对等关税后，德国工厂订单持续上升，打破了人们对其受挫的预期。【原文：German factory orders kept rising after President Donald Trump’s announcement of US reciprocal tariffs, defying expectations for a setback.】

item.title: 交易员斥资 7.55 亿美元押注韩股更多涨幅
item.description: 在本周的大选结束了数月的政治不确定性之后，一位交易商斥资约 7.55 亿美元买入期权，押注韩国股市的反弹还有更长的路要走。【原文：A trader spent around $755 million in options betting South Korea’s stock rally has more to go after this week’s election ended months of political uncertainty.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数连胜势头面临考验
最后的工作给马来西亚棕榈业带来更多压力
item.description: 马来西亚的棕榈油产业正在努力解决劳动力资源日益减少的问题，因为越来越多的工人不愿在种植园从事体力要求很高的工作，这一趋势有可能加剧这个主要种植国的生产困境。【原文：Malaysia’s palm oil industry is grappling with a dwindling labor pool as workers increasingly shun physically demanding jobs at plantations, a trend that threatens to exacerbate production woes in the major grower.】

item.title: 日本再次拍卖疲软债券将加剧全球债务忧虑
item.description: 全球范围内接二连三的较长期限主权债券拍卖反应不佳，引发了人们对投资者是否愿意为从美国到日本等国政府的支出计划提供资金的疑问。【原文：A spate of poorly-received longer-dated sovereign bond auctions worldwide has raised questions about the willingness of investors to fund the spending plans of governments from the US to Japan.】

item.title: 德国有问题，而且问题比唐纳德-特朗普更严重
item.description: 随着唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推进其改变世界经商方式的竞选活动，德国显得格外脆弱。【原文：As Donald Trump pushes ahead with his campaign to transform the way the world does business, Germany is uniquely vulnerable.】

item.title: 贸易混乱拖累经济，欧洲央行将降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行将第八次降低利率，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统对全球贸易的冲击使通胀和经济前景黯淡。【原文：The European Central Bank is set to lower interest rates for an eighth time as President Donald Trump’s jolts to global trade dim the prospects for inflation and the economy.】

item.title: 国际能源署称，需求和价格下降将导致石油投资下降 6
item.description: 根据国际能源机构的数据，2025 年全球石油投资预计将下降 6%，这是十年来首次出现这种下降，科维德事件那年除外。【原文：Global oil investments are expected to drop 6% in 2025, in the first such decline in a decade excluding the year of the Covid slump, according to the International Energy Agency.】

item.title: Neuberger Berman 为新二级基金融资 40 亿美元
item.description: 尽管私人资本筹资环境充满挑战，Neuberger Berman 仍为其普通合伙人领导的最新二级基金筹集了 40 多亿美元。【原文：Neuberger Berman has raised more than $4 billion for its latest general partner-led secondary fund despite a challenging environment for private capital fundraising.】

item.title: 日本 30 年期债券销售吸引了近两年来最弱的需求
item.description: 日本 30 年期国债拍卖的需求弱于过去一年的平均水平，加剧了对全球收益率上升的担忧，并增加了政府调整发行量的压力。【原文：Demand at Japan’s 30-year bond auction was weaker than the average over the past year, adding to concerns over rising yields globally and ramping up pressure on the government to adjust issuance.】

item.title: 特朗普大选 "明显转向"，美国商业乐观情绪下滑
item.description: 美国企业的乐观情绪急剧下降，加深了第一季度出现的趋势，与唐纳德-特朗普连任总统后企业高管的乐观情绪相比，出现了急剧逆转。【原文：US business optimism has moved sharply lower, deepening a trend seen in the first quarter and marking a sharp reversal from the buoyant mood among executives after Donald Trump’s reelection as president.】

item.title: 特朗普为何加倍征收钢铝关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将美国进口钢铁和铝的征税从 25% 提高到 50%，同时他加大了重塑美国与世界其他国家贸易关系的力度。【原文：President Donald Trump raised levies on US imports of steel and aluminum to 50% from 25% as he ratcheted up his campaign to reshape the country’s trade ties with the rest of the world.】

item.title: 越南称以 "善意 "回应美国要求
item.description: 越南说，它正在以 "善意 "回应美国的要求，因为它寻求解决特朗普政府对东南亚国家与美国贸易差距的担忧，避免征收瘫痪性关税。【原文：Vietnam said it is responding to US demands with “goodwill” as it seeks to address the Trump administration’s concerns over the Southeast Asian country’s trade gap with the US and avoid crippling duties.】
